name: 2,5-dinitrophenol
Reason: 2,5-dinitrophenol has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The presence of two phenyl groups contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +20°C per group, totaling +40°C. The dinitro group introduces two significant withdrawing groups, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +40°C each. The phenol group introduces a hydroxyl functional group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by approximately +20°C. The presence of two methoxy groups can also contribute to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +10°C per group, totaling +20°C.
